Catalytic dehydrogenation of propane and butane to alkenes is central to processes like Oleflex, Cyclar, and MB-forming, which convert light gases to aromatics, especially BTX, using catalysts like ZSM-5. The conversion of light alkanes to aromatics is not completely selective, with light alkenes also being formed. On Zn-ZSM-5, part of the hydrogen lost during aromatization is released as dihydrogen, improving BTX selectivity. Ga-ZSM-5 or GaZn-ZSM-5 catalysts operate similarly, with gallium-containing samples preferred due to zinc volatilization at reaction temperatures.", "Chinese": "轻烷烃转化为更有用的产品受到了广泛关注，特别是甲烷催化转化为甲醇或更高碳氢化合物。像C&/C这样的高烷烃可以在没有共反应物的情况下进行转化。丙烷和丁烷的催化脱氢生成烯烃是Oleflex、Cyclar和MB-forming等过程的核心，这些过程将轻气体转化为芳烃，特别是BTX，使用ZSM-5等催化剂。轻烷烃转化为芳烃并不完全选择性，还会形成轻烯烃。在Zn-ZSM-5上，部分在芳构化过程中失去的氢以二氢形式释放，提高了BTX的选择性。Ga-ZSM-5或GaZn-ZSM-5催化剂以类似方式运行，但由于锌在反应温度下挥发，因此更倾向于使用含镓样品。", "Doi": "10.1016/s0166-9834(00)80384-x"},
{"Quotes": "", "English": "The literature does not provide specific information on how the composition, structure, and reaction conditions of metal-based catalysts, including supported vanadium oxides and metal-exchanged zeolites, influence the mechanisms and efficiency of alkane transformations. However, it does discuss the regioselective H/D exchange of propane on Zn/H-MFI zeolite, which is a type of metal-exchanged zeolite. The study shows that the incorporated Zn2+ cations act as strong Lewis sites and change the mechanism of alkane activation and transformation, favoring hydrogen removal. The regioselectivity of the exchange is attributed to two proposed mechanisms: (i) propane dehydrogenation on Zn-sites followed by protonation of propene by acidic OH groups in accordance with Markovnikov's rule and abstraction of deuteride ion from another propane molecule; (ii) the reversible heterolytic dissociative adsorption of propane to form Zn-propyl species and acidic OH groups. The study also indicates that the modification of the zeolite with Zn changes the mechanism of the exchange, leading to regioselectivity in the methyl groups of propane. The kinetic parameters for the H/D exchange in propane-d8 on Zn/H-MFI are different from those reported for H-MFI and sulfated zirconia, suggesting an alternative mechanism of H/D exchange reaction for propane on Zn/H-MFI.", "Chinese": "文献没有提供关于金属基催化剂（包括支撑的钒氧化物和金属交换沸石）的组成、结构和反应条件如何影响烷烃转化机制和效率的具体信息。但是，它确实讨论了Zn/H-MFI沸石上丙烷的区域选择性H/D交换，这是一种金属交换沸石。研究显示，嵌入的Zn2+离子作为强Lewis位点，改变了烷烃活化和转化的机制，有利于氢的去除。交换的区域选择性归因于两种提出的机制：(i)在Zn位点上丙烷脱氢，然后按照马尔科夫尼科夫规则，由酸性OH基团对丙烯进行质子化，并从另一个丙烷分子中抽提氘离子；(ii)可逆的异裂吸附丙烷，形成Zn-丙基物种和酸性OH基团。研究还表明，沸石用Zn改性会改变交换机制，导致丙烷甲基组分的区域选择性。Zn/H-MFI上丙烷-d8的H/D交换的热力学参数与H-MFI和硫酸化锆石报道的参数不同，这表明Zn/H-MFI上丙烷的H/D交换反应存在替代机制。", "Doi": "10.1007/s10562-007-9044-6"},
{"Quotes": "[1] \"ROLE OF VANADIUM AS THE PREFERRED ELEMENT IN CATALYSTS FOR SELECTIVE OXIDATION OF ALKANES .\"\n          [2] \"ROLE OF THE ISOLATION OF VANADIUM IONS IN A QUASI-INERT MATRIX\"\n          [3] \"ROLE OF THE STABILITY OF THE PRODUCT .\"\n          [4] \"ROLE OF MULTIFUNCTIONALITY .\"\n          [5] \"A. Multifunctionality as a Criterion in Catalyst Design . .\"\n          [6] \"B. Multifunctionality as a Tool to Explain the Reaction Mechanism\"\n          [7] \"C. Inadequacy of Multifunctionality Alone .\"\n          [8] \"ROLE OF THE TYPE OF C-H BOND ACTIVATION .\"\n          [9] \"ROLE OF ACIDITY AND BASICITY .\"", "English": "The composition, structure, and reaction conditions of metal-based catalysts, including supported vanadium oxides and metal-exchanged zeolites, play significant roles in the mechanisms and efficiency of alkane transformations. Vanadium is the preferred element in catalysts for selective oxidation of alkanes. The isolation of vanadium ions in a quasi-inert matrix is crucial. The stability of the product, multifunctionality, the type of C-H bond activation, and the role of acidity and basicity also contribute to the efficiency of these processes. Multifunctionality can be used as a criterion in catalyst design and as a tool to explain the reaction mechanism, but it is not adequate alone. These factors are essential for the industrial significance of oxidative dehydrogenation and zeolite-catalyzed reactions.", "Chinese": "金属基催化剂的组成、结构和反应条件，包括支撑的钒氧化物和金属交换沸石，在烷烃转化的机制和效率中起着重要作用。钒是选择性氧化烷烃催化剂的首选元素。将钒离子隔离在准惰性基质中是至关重要的。产物的稳定性、多功能性、C-H键活化类型以及酸性和碱性的作用也对这些过程的效率有贡献。多功能性可以作为催化剂设计的标准，并作为解释反应机制的工具，但仅此是不够的。这些因素对于氧化脱氢和沸石催化反应的工业重要性是必不可少的。", "Doi": "10.1080/01614949608006463"},
{"Quotes": "", "English": "The literature does not provide specific information on how the composition, structure, and reaction conditions of metal-based catalysts, including supported vanadium oxides and metal-exchanged zeolites, influence the mechanisms and efficiency of alkane transformations. However, it does discuss the role of zinc-modified H-MFI catalysts in propane activation. The study found that the initial step of propane conversion over Zn-containing zeolites is dissociative adsorption over Zn oxide species, leading to the formation of propyl zinc species and ZnOH groups. The subsequent dehydrogenation of propyl groups and recombination of hydrogen over Zn sites leads to propylene and dihydrogen formation and regeneration of an active catalytic site. Propylene undergoes further oligomerization over the neighbouring acidic site, whereas dihydrogen may participate in propane hydrogenolysis under certain reaction conditions. The recombinative hydrogen desorption shifts the reaction equilibrium toward propylene formation, which further undergoes oligomerization, cyclization, and aromatization, accounting for the higher aromatization activity of Zn-containing zeolites with respect to pure acidic sites. The efficiency of this process is influenced by the partial pressure of reactants, with hydrogen evolution favored at low pressures and hydrogenolysis preferred at high pressures. The industrial significance of these catalysts lies in their ability to convert light alkanes to aromatics, which are important petrochemical feedstocks.", "Chinese": "文献没有提供具体信息，说明金属基催化剂（包括支撑的钒氧化物和金属交换沸石）的组成、结构和反应条件如何影响烷烃转化的机制和效率。但是，它确实讨论了锌改性的H-MFI催化剂在丙烷活化中的作用。研究发现，Zn含沸石上丙烷转化的初始步骤是Zn氧化物位点上的解离吸附，导致丙基锌物种和ZnOH基团的形成。随后，丙基基团的脱氢和Zn位点上的氢重组导致丙烯和二氢的形成，以及活性催化位点的再生。丙烯在邻近的酸性位点进一步发生聚合，而二氢在某些反应条件下可能参与丙烷的氢解。重组氢的解吸使反应平衡向丙烯的形成转移，丙烯进一步发生聚合、环化和芳构化，这解释了Zn含沸石相对于纯酸性位点的更高芳构化活性。这一过程的效率受到反应物的部分压力的影响，在低压力下，氢的生成被优先考虑，而在高压力下，氢解作用更受青睐。这些催化剂的工业重要性在于它们能够将轻烷烃转化为芳烃，后者是重要的石化原料。", "Doi": "10.1016/j.jcat.2005.11.037"},
{"Quotes": "The catalytic conversion of methane to desired chemical products or liquid fuel is not only a promising approach for the utilization of natural gas resource but also a great challenge to catalysis science.\n          The Mo modified ZSM-5 catalysts exhibited excellent catalytic activity and selectivity to benzene for the conversion of methane at 973 K under non-oxidizing conditions.\n          The Mo or Zn loaded in the ZSM-5 played a significant role in methane activation.\n          The yield of benzene increased with increasing partial pressure of methane.\n          The dehydrogenation and aromatization of methane on modified ZSM-5 zeolite catalysts has been studied under non-oxidizing conditions with a fixed bed continuous-flow reactor and with a temperature programmed reactor.\n          The catalytic activity of ZSM-5 is greatly improved by incorporating a metal cation (Mo or Zn).\n          A carbenium ion mechanism for the activation of methane is suggested.", "English": "The catalytic conversion of methane to desired chemical products or liquid fuel is a promising approach for the utilization of natural gas resources and a significant challenge for catalysis science. Mo modified ZSM-5 catalysts show excellent catalytic activity and selectivity to benzene for the conversion of methane at 973 K under non-oxidizing conditions. The incorporation of Mo or Zn in ZSM-5 plays a significant role in methane activation. The yield of benzene increases with increasing partial pressure of methane. The composition and structure of metal-based catalysts, such as modified ZSM-5 zeolites with incorporated Mo or Zn, significantly influence the mechanisms and efficiency of alkane transformations. The catalytic activity of ZSM-5 is enhanced by the addition of metal cations, leading to improved dehydrogenation and aromatization of methane under non-oxidizing conditions. The reaction conditions, including temperature and the presence of a carbenium ion mechanism, contribute to the industrial significance of these catalysts by enabling the conversion of methane to benzene with high selectivity and stability. These factors contribute to the industrial significance of metal-based catalysts in alkane transformations.", "Chinese": "将甲烷催化转化为所需的化学产品或液体燃料是利用天然气资源的一种有前途的方法，但对催化科学来说也是一个巨大的挑战。Mo改性的ZSM-5催化剂在973 K的非氧化条件下，对甲烷转化为苯显示出优异的催化活性和选择性。在ZSM-5中加入Mo或Zn对甲烷的活化起着重要作用。随着甲烷分压的增加，苯的产量也随之增加。金属基催化剂的组成和结构,如含有Mo或Zn的改性ZSM-5沸石,对烷烃转化的机制和效率有重大影响。通过添加金属阳离子,如Mo或Zn,可以增强ZSM-5的催化活性,在非氧化条件下促进甲烷的脱氢和芳构化。反应条件,包括温度和存在碳正离子机制,通过使甲烷转化为苯具有高选择性和稳定性,为这些催化剂的工业意义做出了贡献。这些因素促成了金属基催化剂在烷烃转化中的工业重要性。", "Doi": "10.1007/bf00767368"},
{"Quotes": "", "English": "The composition, structure, and reaction conditions of metal-based catalysts, including supported vanadium oxides and metal-exchanged zeolites, significantly influence the mechanisms and efficiency of alkane transformations, particularly in processes such as oxidative dehydrogenation and zeolite-catalyzed reactions. The study of propane oxidative dehydrogenation on single-crystal V2O5(001) by periodic density functional theory (DFT) calculations reveals that the CH bond of propane can be activated by both the terminal and the bridging lattice O atoms on the surface with similar activation energies. At the terminal O site, both the radical and the oxo-insertion pathways are likely for the CH bond activation, while only the oxo-insertion mechanism is feasible at the bridging O site. The propene production from the propoxide at the bridging O site is much easier due to the weaker binding of propoxide at the bridging O. It is concluded that single-crystal V2O5(001) is not a good catalyst due to the terminal O being too active to release propene. An efficient catalyst for the oxidative dehydrogenation (ODH) reaction has to make a compromise between the ability to activate the CH bond and the ability to release propene. The industrial significance of these catalysts lies in their ability to convert inexpensive raw materials like alkanes into more valuable products like olefins through selective oxidation, which is a promising solution to meet the ever-increasing worldwide demand for olefins.", "Chinese": "金属基催化剂的组成、结构和反应条件，包括负载型钒氧化物和金属交换沸石，对烷烃转化的机制和效率，特别是在氧化脱氢和沸石催化反应等过程中，有着重大影响。通过周期性密度泛函理论(DFT)计算研究丙烷在单晶V2O5(001)表面的氧化脱氢，发现丙烷的CH键可以被表面的终端和桥接晶格O原子以相似的活化能激活。在终端O位点，CH键的激活可能通过自由基和氧插入两种途径，而在桥接O位点，只有氧插入机制是可行的。从桥接O位点的丙氧基产生丙烯要容易得多，因为丙氧基在桥接O上的结合力较弱。结论是单晶V2O5(001)不是一个好的催化剂，因为终端O太活跃，无法释放丙烯。一个有效的氧化脱氢(ODH)反应催化剂必须在激活CH键的能力和释放丙烯的能力之间做出妥协。这些催化剂的工业重要性在于它们能够通过选择性氧化将廉价的原料如烷烃转化为更有价值的产品如烯烃，这是满足全球对烯烃日益增长需求的有希望的解决方案。", "Doi": "10.1021/ja0611745"},
{"Quotes": "[1] \"On two alternative mechanisms of ethane activation over ZSM-5 zeolite modified by Zn21 and Ga11 cations\"\n          [2] \"The activation of ethane over zinc- and gallium-modified HZSM-5 dehydrogenation catalysts was studied by diffuse reflectance infrared spectroscopy.\"\n          [3] \"Hydrocarbon activation on HZSM-5 modified by bivalent Zn and univalent Ga cations proceeds via two distinctly different mechanisms.\"\n          [4] \"The stronger molecular adsorption of ethane by the acidbase pairs formed by distantly separated cationic Zn21 and basic oxygen sites results already at room temperature in strong polarizability of adsorbed ethane and subsequent heterolytic dissociative adsorption at moderate temperatures.\"\n          [5] \"In contrast, molecular adsorption of ethane on Ga1 cations is weak.\"\n          [6] \"At high temperatures dissociative hydrocarbon adsorption takes place, resulting in the formation of ethyl and hydride fragments coordinating to the cationic gallium species.\"\n          [7] \"Whereas in the zinc case a Brnsted acid proton is formed upon ethane dissociation, decomposition of the ethyl fragment on gallium results in gallium dihydride species and does not lead to Brnsted acid protons.\"\n          [8] \"This difference in alkane activation has direct consequences for hydrocarbon conversions involving dehydrogenation.\"", "English": "The mechanisms and efficiency of alkane transformations, particularly in processes such as oxidative dehydrogenation and zeolite-catalyzed reactions, are influenced by the composition and structure of metal-based catalysts, including supported vanadium oxides and metal-exchanged zeolites. The study of ethane activation over zinc- and gallium-modified HZSM-5 dehydrogenation catalysts by diffuse reflectance infrared spectroscopy reveals two distinctly different mechanisms. The stronger molecular adsorption of ethane by the acidbase pairs formed by distantly separated cationic Zn21 and basic oxygen sites results in strong polarizability of adsorbed ethane and subsequent heterolytic dissociative adsorption at moderate temperatures. In contrast, molecular adsorption of ethane on Ga1 cations is weak, and at high temperatures, dissociative hydrocarbon adsorption takes place, resulting in the formation of ethyl and hydride fragments coordinating to the cationic gallium species. The formation of Brnsted acid protons upon ethane dissociation in the zinc case contrasts with the formation of gallium dihydride species and the absence of Brnsted acid protons in the gallium case. This difference in alkane activation has direct consequences for hydrocarbon conversions involving dehydrogenation, influencing the efficiency and selectivity of the reactions. The industrial significance of these catalysts lies in their ability to selectively convert alkanes into more valuable products, such as ethylene, through dehydrogenation processes.", "Chinese": "烷烃转化机制和效率,特别是在氧化脱氢和沸石催化反应等过程中,受到基于金属的催化剂,包括支撑的钒氧化物和金属交换沸石的组成和结构的影响。通过扩散反射红外光谱学研究锌和镓改性的HZSM-5脱氢催化剂上的乙烷活化,揭示了两种截然不同的机制。由远距离分离的阳离子Zn21和基本氧位点形成的酸碱对对乙烷的强分子吸附导致吸附乙烷的强极化,并在中等温度下随后发生异裂解吸附。相比之下,乙烷在Ga1阳离子上的分子吸附较弱,在高温下,发生解离性烃吸附,导致形成与阳离子镓物种配位的乙基和氢化物片段。在锌的情况下,乙烷解离时形成Brnsted酸质子,而在镓的情况下,乙基片段在镓上分解形成镓二氢化物物种,不会导致形成Brnsted酸质子。这种烷烃活化机制的差异对涉及脱氢的烃转化有直接影响,影响反应的效率和选择性。这些催化剂的工业重要性在于它们能够选择性地将烷烃转化为更有价值的产品,如乙烯,通过脱氢过程。", "Doi": "10.1039/b506782k"},
{"Quotes": "", "English": "The literature does not provide specific information on how the composition, structure, and reaction conditions of metal-based catalysts influence the mechanisms and efficiency of alkane transformations. However, it does mention that catalyst development has played a crucial role in the advances of methane conversion processes, and that there remains a need for catalysts that promote higher selectivity to the desired product and have a longer life. The literature also discusses the use of certain catalysts, such as FePO4 for the production of CH3OH and HCHO, and Mo/H-ZSM-5 zeolite for the conversion of methane to aromatics. The efficiency and selectivity of these catalysts are influenced by factors such as pretreatment conditions, reaction temperature, the presence of certain additives, the state and location of the active form of the metal, and the presence of other compounds in the feed.", "Chinese": "文献没有提供关于金属基催化剂的组成、结构和反应条件如何影响烷烃转化机制和效率的具体信息。但是，它确实提到催化剂开发在甲烷转化过程的进展中发挥了关键作用，并且仍然需要能够促进更高选择性和更长寿命的催化剂。文献还讨论了使用某些催化剂，如FePO4用于生产CH3OH和HCHO，以及Mo/H-ZSM-5沸石用于将甲烷转化为芳烃。这些催化剂的效率和选择性受到预处理条件、反应温度、某些添加剂的存在、金属活性形式的状态和位置以及进料中其他化合物的存在等因素的影响。", "Doi": "10.1016/s0920-5861(00)00456-9"},
{"Quotes": "[1] \"The effects of support (Al2O3, SiO2, HfO2, TiO2, and ZrO2) on the structure and catalytic behavior of supported vanadia in the oxidative dehydrogenation of propane were examined over a wide range of vanadium surface densities (0.515.0 VOx/nm2).\"\n          [2] \"X-ray diffrac- tion and Raman and UV-visible spectra showed that vanadia exists as highly dispersed species at surface densities below 7 VOx/nm2 on Al2O3, HfO2, TiO2, and ZrO2, but as large V2O5 crystallites on SiO2.\"\n          [3] \"Surface structures evolve from isolated monovanadates to polyvanadate domains and V2O5 crystallites as VOx surface density increases.\"\n          [4] \"Polyvanadates appear at lower surface densities on ZrO2 and TiO2 than on Al2O3 and HfO2.\"\n          [5] \"UV-visible edge energies decrease as VOx domains grow with increasing VOx surface density on all supports.\"\n          [6] \"Initial propene selectivities increase with increasing VOx surface density, as monovanadate species and exposed support sites, which favor primary combustion pathways, decrease in con- centration.\"\n          [7] \"Oxidative dehydrogenation rates per V-atom reach a maximum on VOx domains of intermediate size, which provide a balance between the activity of surface VOx species and their acces- sibility to reactants.\"\n          [8] \"Interactions with supports determine the type of VOx structures present at a given surface density, but turnover rates do not depend on the identity of the support when differences in VOx structure are taken into account.\"\n          [9] \"Oxidative dehydrogenation turnover rates are similar on polyvanadate species and on surface VOx sites on bulk V2O5.\"\n          [10] \"The relative rates of oxidative dehydro- genation to form propene and of secondary propene oxidation to COx do not depend on the identity of the support or on VOx sur- face density or structure.\"", "English": "The structure and catalytic behavior of supported vanadia in the oxidative dehydrogenation of propane are influenced by the type of support (Al2O3, SiO2, HfO2, TiO2, and ZrO2) and the vanadium surface density. Vanadia exists as highly dispersed species at surface densities below 7 VOx/nm2 on Al2O3, HfO2, TiO2, and ZrO2, but as large V2O5 crystallites on SiO2. Surface structures evolve from isolated monovanadates to polyvanadate domains and V2O5 crystallites as VOx surface density increases. Polyvanadates appear at lower surface densities on ZrO2 and TiO2 than on Al2O3 and HfO2. UV-visible edge energies decrease as VOx domains grow with increasing VOx surface density on all supports. Initial propene selectivities increase with increasing VOx surface density, as monovanadate species and exposed support sites, which favor primary combustion pathways, decrease in concentration. Oxidative dehydrogenation rates per V-atom reach a maximum on VOx domains of intermediate size, which provide a balance between the activity of surface VOx species and their accessibility to reactants. Interactions with supports determine the type of VOx structures present at a given surface density, but turnover rates do not depend on the identity of the support when differences in VOx structure are taken into account. Oxidative dehydrogenation turnover rates are similar on polyvanadate species and on surface VOx sites on bulk V2O5. The relative rates of oxidative dehydrogenation to form propene and of secondary propene oxidation to COx do not depend on the identity of the support or on VOx surface density or structure. These findings contribute to the understanding of how the composition, structure, and reaction conditions of metal-based catalysts, including supported vanadium oxides, influence the mechanisms and efficiency of alkane transformations, particularly in processes such as oxidative dehydrogenation.", "Chinese": "在丙烷氧化脱氢反应中，支撑型钒氧化物的结构和催化行为受支撑物类型（Al2O3，SiO2，HfO2，TiO2和ZrO2）和钒表面密度的影响。在Al2O3，HfO2，TiO2和ZrO2上，表面密度低于7 VOx/nm2时，钒氧化物以高度分散的物种存在，但在SiO2上则以大V2O5晶体存在。随着VOx表面密度的增加，表面结构从孤立的单钒酸盐演变为聚钒酸盐域和V2O5晶体。聚钒酸盐在ZrO2和TiO2上的表面密度比在Al2O3和HfO2上出现得更低。随着所有载体上VOx域的增大，UV-可见边缘能量降低。随着VOx表面密度的增加，初始丙烯选择性增加，因为单钒酸盐物种和暴露的载体位点，这些位点有利于初级燃烧途径，浓度降低。每V-原子的氧化脱氢速率在VOx域的中间大小时达到最大，这在表面VOx物种的活性和它们对反应物的可及性之间提供了平衡。与载体的相互作用决定了在给定表面密度下存在的VOx结构类型，但在考虑到VOx结构差异时，周转率并不依赖于载体的身份。聚钒酸盐物种和大块V2O5上的表面VOx位点上的氧化脱氢周转率是相似的。形成丙烯的氧化脱氢的相对速率和丙烯的二次氧化到COx并不依赖于载体的身份或VOx表面密度或结构。这些发现有助于理解金属基催化剂，包括支撑的钒氧化物，如何通过其组成，结构和反应条件影响烷烃转化的机制和效率，特别是在氧化脱氢等过程中。", "Doi": "10.1006/jcat.1998.2295"},
{"Quotes": "[1] \"The zinc-exchanged (ZSM-5-Zn) and proton-exchanged (ZSM-5-H) forms of ZSM-5 zeolite have been studied for the conversion of propane to aromatic hydrocarbons at temperatures in the range 730-820 K. ZSM-5-Zn was the more active and gave the better BTX selectivity (60-7OC%).\"\n          [2] \"The main features of the conversion mechanism are proposed involving propane dehydrogenation,followed by oligomerization and aromatization.\"\n          [3] \"Cracking to Cl-C2 products is a concurrent reaction. The primary dehydrogenation reaction is mechanistically different on the two types of catalyst: over ZSM-5-H dehydrogenat- ion is rate controlled,while over ZSM-5-Zn this step is in quasi-equilibrium.\"\n          [4] \"The way in which ZSM-5-H might be able to initiate a radical-chain reaction remains a matter for conjecture.\"\n          [5] \"ZSM-5-H and ZSM-5-Zn show quite different dependences of selectivity upon space velocity (c.f. Figures 1 and 2).\"\n          [6] \"We suggest that over ZSM-5-Zn the relatively high rate of hydrogen diffusion in the zeolite channels results in in- creasing depletion of the local hydrogen concentration with increasing space velocity, thus moving the equilibrium in the direction of BTX formation.\"\n          [7] \"The present results suggest that part of the C,-C3 hydrocarbon product formed in propane conversion over the present ZSM-5 catalysts,particularly ZSM-5-Zn,may have arisen from secondary demethylation reactions of aromatic products.\"\n          [8] \"The apparent activation energies, obtained from Arrhenius plots of the propane conversions,were ZSM-5-Zn (I.28 wt% aluminium),121+15 kJ mol-'; ZSM-5-Zn (0.71 wt% aluminium),104+15 kJ mol-'; ZSM-5-H (1.28 wt% aluminium),120t15 kJ mol-'.\"\n          [9] \"Over ZSM-5-Zn the BTX selectivity increased to a small extent.\"\n          [10] \"The way in which ZSM-5-H might be able to initiate a radical-chain reaction remains a matter for conjecture.\"\n          [11] \"However, it is known [lZ] that adsorption of aromatics or olefins on high silica zeolites can involve electron transfer pro- cesses and the generation of some radical species which can be detected by EPR.\"\n          [12] \"We suggest that this different behaviour compared with the protonic form of the catalyst has its origin in the basically different aromatization mechanisms.\"\n          [13] \"As pointed out in the previous discussion,aromatization on ZSM-5-Zn generates hydrogen, as opposed to the hydride transfer mechanism which operates over ZSM-5-H (and which generates paraffins).\"\n          [14] \"We suggest that over ZSM-5-Zn the BTX-forming dehydrogenation process is in quasi-equilibrium (while over ZSM-5-H it is not), also provides an explanation for the different behaviour of the BTX selectivity with changing space velocity over the two catalysts.\"\n          [15] \"The present results suggest that part of the C,-C3 hydrocarbon product formed in propane conversion over the present ZSM-5 catalysts,particularly ZSM-5-Zn,may have arisen from secondary demethylation reactions of aromatic products.\"", "English": "The zinc-exchanged (ZSM-5-Zn) and proton-exchanged (ZSM-5-H) forms of ZSM-5 zeolite have been studied for the conversion of propane to aromatic hydrocarbons at temperatures in the range 730-820 K. ZSM-5-Zn was the more active and gave the better BTX selectivity. The main features of the conversion mechanism involve propane dehydrogenation, followed by oligomerization and aromatization. Cracking to Cl-C2 products is a concurrent reaction. The primary dehydrogenation reaction is mechanistically different on the two types of catalyst: over ZSM-5-H dehydrogenation is rate controlled, while over ZSM-5-Zn this step is in quasi-equilibrium. The apparent activation energies for propane conversions were 121+15 kJ mol-1 for ZSM-5-Zn (1.28 wt% aluminium), 104+15 kJ mol-1 for ZSM-5-Zn (0.71 wt% aluminium), and 120+15 kJ mol-1 for ZSM-5-H (1.28 wt% aluminium). Over ZSM-5-Zn, the BTX selectivity increased slightly. The way in which ZSM-5-H might be able to initiate a radical-chain reaction remains speculative. However, it is known that adsorption of aromatics or olefins on high silica zeolites can involve electron transfer processes and the generation of some radical species which can be detected by EPR. The different behavior compared with the protonic form of the catalyst has its origin in the basically different aromatization mechanisms. Aromatization on ZSM-5-Zn generates hydrogen, as opposed to the hydride transfer mechanism which operates over ZSM-5-H (and which generates paraffins). The present results suggest that part of the C,-C3 hydrocarbon product formed in propane conversion over the present ZSM-5 catalysts, particularly ZSM-5-Zn, may have arisen from secondary demethylation reactions of aromatic products.", "Chinese": "研究了锌交换（ZSM-5-Zn）和质子交换（ZSM-5-H）形式的ZSM-5沸石催化剂在730-820 K温度范围内将丙烷转化为芳烃。ZSM-5-Zn更活跃，给出了更好的BTX选择性。转化机制的主要特征涉及丙烷脱氢，随后是寡聚化和芳构化。裂解至Cl-C2产物是并行反应。两种催化剂上的初级脱氢反应在机制上是不同的：在ZSM-5-H上，脱氢是受速率控制的，而在ZSM-5-Zn上，这一步骤处于准平衡状态。丙烷转化的表观活化能为ZSM-5-Zn（1.28 wt%铝）121+15 kJ mol-1，ZSM-5-Zn（0.71 wt%铝）104+15 kJ mol-1，ZSM-5-H（1.28 wt%铝）120+15 kJ mol-1。在ZSM-5-Zn上，BTX选择性略有增加。ZSM-5-H可能引发自由基链反应的方式仍然存在猜测。然而，已知在高硅沸石上吸附芳烃或烯烃可以涉及电子转移过程，并生成一些可以通过EPR检测的自由基物种。与质子形式的催化剂相比，不同的行为源于基本上不同的芳构化机制。ZSM-5-Zn上的芳构化产生氢气，而ZSM-5-H上的氢化转移机制（产生石蜡）则不同。目前的结果表明，在ZSM-5催化剂（特别是ZSM-5-Zn）上丙烷转化形成的C,-C3烃产物中，部分可能来自芳烃产物的二次脱甲基反应。", "Doi": "10.1016/s0166-9834(00)82709-8"},
{"Quotes": "[1] \"Effects of pretreatments on state of gallium and aromatization activity of gallium/ZSM-5 catalysts\"\n          [2] \"The gallium in ion-exchanged ZSM-5, both with and without additional Ga203,can be reduced to Ga+, in the former case up to a limit determined by the number of anionic framework sites.\"\n          [3] \"An ion-exchanged,reduced catalyst exhibits similar redox behavior,and is as active for propane aromatization,as catalysts prepared from purely physical mixtures of Ga203 and H- ZSM-5.\"\n          [4] \"Although reduction generates dispersed,active gallium species in zeolite channels,it is shown that for ethane dehydrogenation to aromatics the reduced (with hydrogen) Ga/ZSM-5 catalysts are not as active or selective as are materials which have been substantially reoxidized either by air or by traces of oxygen in inert gases.\"\n          [5] \"A combination of thermogravimetric analysis (TGA) , differential scanning calorimetry (DSC), and X-ray diffraction (XRD) studies has been used to confirm that rapid reoxi- dation takes place at 550C.\"\n          [6] \"However,the reoxidation does not regenerate /I-GasO,,but rather a higher energy,dispersed Ga3+ which appears to be optimal for production of aromatics from ethane.\"\n          [7] \"This form of Ga3+ is stable under reaction conditions typical of ethane dehydrogenation,but can be reduced by hydrogen.\"\n          [8] \"Keywords: Aromatization,gallium,zeolites,ZSM-5.\"\n          [9] \"Our recent work on gallium-containing MFI catalysts for light alkane aro- matization has led us to the conclusion that hydrogen-reduced Ga,O,/ZSM-5 mixtures, with a least some Gal+ in the starting material, is very active and selective for propane aromatization.\"\n          [10] \"This conclusion is based upon the obser- vations that: (1) selectivities and activities for aromatics production from pro- pane were greatly improved with hydrogen pretreatment [ 1,2]; (2) we were unable to detect gallium insertion into the zeolitic framework upon reduction [2]; and (3) we have been able to correlate hydrogen reduction of Ga,O,/H- ZSM-5 mechanical mixtures and Ga ( NOs),/H-ZSM-5 impregnated materials\"\n          [11] \"It is generally agreed that the primary role of extra-framework gallium in these materials is to enhance rates of alkene,diene,or cycloalkene dehydro- genation [5-81.\"\n          [12] \"High surface area GazO, and steamed gallosilicates by them- selves can aromatize aliphatic dienes,1-hexene,and cyclohexene at significant rates over the temperature range 500-600 C [ 7,8].\"\n          [13] \"Therefore the dispersion and the oxidation state of gallium within zeolite channels should greatly affect the relative rates of alkane dehydrogenation and hydrocracking;the aromat- ics/methane selectivity ratio should be a good indicator of these relative rates.\"\n          [14] \"In order to distinguish more clearly the effects of various pretreatment cliques on catalyst performance,we have also tested various preparations of Ga/ZSM-5 for the dehyogenation of ethane.\"\n          [15] \"In order to give high yields to aromatics,rhenium,platinum,or rhodium are often added to the catalysts in small amounts.\"\n          [16] \"The aims of the work presented in this paper were: (1) to obtain evidence that gallium-exchanged materials also fall into our stoichiometric theory on gallium reduction;and (2) to demonstrate that although the reduction of Ga& is necessary to disperse gallium within the zeolite, the form of the catalyst which is most active and selective for the production of aromatics does not consist of reduced Ga+ as framework cations.\"", "English": "The state of gallium and the pretreatments of gallium/ZSM-5 catalysts have significant effects on the aromatization activity. The gallium in ion-exchanged ZSM-5 can be reduced to Ga+, which is limited by the number of anionic framework sites. The reduced catalyst exhibits similar redox behavior and is as active for propane aromatization as catalysts prepared from physical mixtures of Ga203 and H-ZSM-5. However, for ethane dehydrogenation to aromatics, the reduced Ga/ZSM-5 catalysts are not as active or selective as materials that have been substantially reoxidized. Reoxidation at 550C generates a higher energy, dispersed Ga3+ which is optimal for the production of aromatics from ethane. This form of Ga3+ is stable under typical reaction conditions for ethane dehydrogenation but can be reduced by hydrogen. The role of extra-framework gallium in these materials is to enhance rates of alkene, diene, or cycloalkene dehydrogenation. High surface area Ga2O3 and steamed gallosilicates can aromatize aliphatic dienes, 1-hexene, and cyclohexene at significant rates over the temperature range 500-600C. The dispersion and oxidation state of gallium within zeolite channels greatly affect the relative rates of alkane dehydrogenation and hydrocracking. The aromatics/methane selectivity ratio is a good indicator of these relative rates. The effects of various pretreatments on catalyst performance for ethane dehydrogenation have been tested. To achieve high yields of aromatics, small amounts of rhenium, platinum, or rhodium are often added to the catalysts. The reduction of Ga2O3 is necessary to disperse gallium within the zeolite, but the most active and selective catalyst for the production of aromatics does not consist of reduced Ga+ as framework cations.", "Chinese": "镓的状态和镓/ZSM-5催化剂的预处理对芳构化活性有显著影响。ZSM-5中交换的镓可以还原为Ga+，这受到晶格中阴离子位点数量的限制。还原的催化剂表现出类似的氧化还原行为，对于丙烷芳构化，其活性与Ga203和H-ZSM-5物理混合物制备的催化剂相当。然而，对于乙烷脱氢生成芳烃，还原的Ga/ZSM-5催化剂不如经过充分再氧化的材料活性高或选择性好。在550C下再氧化生成更高能量、分散的Ga3+，这在从乙烷生产芳烃方面是最佳的。这种形式的Ga3+在典型的乙烷脱氢反应条件下是稳定的，但可以被氢还原。这些材料中框架外镓的主要作用是增强烯烃、二烯烃或环烯烃的脱氢速率。高表面积的Ga2O3和蒸煮的镓硅酸盐在500-600C的温度范围内可以显著速率芳构化脂肪族二烯烃、1-己烯和环己烯。镓在沸石通道内的分散和氧化态对烷烃脱氢和水裂解的相对速率有很大影响。芳烃/甲烷选择性比是这些相对速率的良好指标。对乙烷脱氢催化剂性能的各种预处理效果进行了测试。为了获得高产率的芳烃，通常在催化剂中添加少量的铼、铂或铑。Ga2O3的还原对于在沸石内分散镓是必要的，但最活跃和选择性最高的催化剂用于生产芳烃并不包含还原的Ga+作为框架阳离子。", "Doi": "10.1016/0926-860x(92)80336-b"},
{"Quotes": "[1] \"The rate of propane dehydrocyclodimerization to form C 6 -- aromatics is limited by a sequence of irreversible dehydrogenation reactions leading to propene, higher alkenes, dienes, tfienes, and aromatics.\"\n          [2] \"Ga and Zn species increase the rates of propane chemical conversion, recombinative hydrogen desorption, and deuterium incorporation from D 2 into reaction products.\"\n          [3] \"Disposal of hydrogen formed in C-H bond activation steps occurs by transfer of H-atoms to unsaturated species to form alkanes or to Ga and Zn species, which catalyze the recombinative desorption of H-atoms to form dihydrogen (H2).\"\n          [4] \"The sequential release of several H-atoms during a propane dehydrocyclodimerization turnover limits the rate and selectivity of this reaction on H-ZSM5.\"\n          [5] \"Ga and Zn species increase the rate of H 2 formation via recombinative desorption of H-atoms formed in dehydrogenation steps.\"\n          [6] \"Ga and Zn sites allow dehydrogenation reactions to occur without the requirement for concurrent cracking.\"\n          [7] \"The addition of metal species to H-ZSM5 channels increase aromatic turnover rates and actually decrease cracking turnover rates.\"\n          [8] \"Ga and Zn species catalyze the recombinative desorption of H-atoms formed in an acid-catalyzed C-H bond activation reaction occurring as a first step in every dehydrogenation event required for an aromatization turnover.\"\n          [9] \"Ga and Zn species increase the rate of propene formation by removing H-atoms from acid sites that activate C-H bonds, allowing acid sites to turnover without the formation of cracking products.\"\n          [10] \"Ga and Zn act as 'portholes' and catalyze the recombinative desorption of H-atoms, formed from acid-catalyzed C-H bond cleavage, as all-hydrogen (He).\"", "English": "The composition, structure, and reaction conditions of metal-based catalysts, including supported vanadium oxides and metal-exchanged zeolites, significantly influence the mechanisms and efficiency of alkane transformations. The rate of propane dehydrocyclodimerization to form C6 aromatics is limited by a sequence of irreversible dehydrogenation reactions leading to various unsaturated hydrocarbons and aromatics. Ga and Zn species increase the rates of propane chemical conversion, recombinative hydrogen desorption, and deuterium incorporation from D2 into reaction products. These metal species facilitate the disposal of hydrogen formed in C-H bond activation steps by catalyzing the recombinative desorption of H-atoms to form dihydrogen (H2). The sequential release of several H-atoms during a propane dehydrocyclodimerization turnover limits the rate and selectivity of this reaction on H-ZSM5. Ga and Zn species enhance the rate of H2 formation via recombinative desorption of H-atoms formed in dehydrogenation steps, allowing dehydrogenation reactions to occur without the requirement for concurrent cracking. The addition of metal species to H-ZSM5 channels increases aromatic turnover rates and decreases cracking turnover rates. These metal species act as 'portholes' for the removal of H-atoms, improving the efficiency of alkane transformations and contributing to their industrial significance. The industrial significance of metal-based catalysts in alkane transformations is attributed to their ability to enhance reaction rates and selectivities. Ga and Zn species increase the rate of propene formation by removing H-atoms from acid sites that activate C-H bonds, allowing acid sites to turnover without the formation of cracking products. This results in higher yields of desired products and reduced formation of by-products such as methane and ethane. The selective removal of H-atoms by recombinative desorption also contributes to the extraction of valuable H2 with high selectivity from light alkanes, which is highly desired in industrial processes.", "Chinese": "金属基催化剂的组成、结构和反应条件，包括支撑的钒氧化物和金属交换沸石，对烷烃转化的机制和效率有重大影响。丙烷脱氢环二聚化形成C6芳烃的速率受到一系列不可逆脱氢反应的限制，这些反应导致丙烯、更高烯烃、二烯、tfienes和芳烃的形成。Ga和Zn物种增加了丙烷化学转化、重组氢脱附和从D2向反应产物中掺入氘的速率。在C-H键活化步骤中形成的氢的处置通过将H原子转移到不饱和物种以形成烷烃或转移到Ga和Zn物种，这些物种催化H原子的重组脱附以形成二氢（H2）。在H-ZSM5上，丙烷脱氢环二聚化周转期间几个H原子的连续释放限制了该反应的速率和选择性。Ga和Zn物种通过重组脱附增加H2的形成速率，这是在脱氢步骤中形成的H原子。Ga和Zn位点允许脱氢反应在没有同时裂解的需要的情况下发生。在H-ZSM5通道中添加金属物种增加了芳烃周转率，实际上降低了裂解周转率。Ga和Zn物种催化在每个芳构化周转所需的脱氢事件中作为第一步的酸催化的C-H键活化反应中形成的H原子的重组脱附。Ga和Zn物种通过从激活C-H键的酸位点去除H原子来增加丙烯的形成速率，使酸位点在没有裂解产物形成的情况下周转。Ga和Zn作为'portholes'，催化从酸催化的C-H键断裂中形成的H原子的重组脱附，作为所有氢（He）。这些因素对它们在氧化脱氢和沸石催化的反应等过程中的工业重要性有贡献。金属基催化剂在烷烃转化中的工业重要性归因于它们能够提高反应速率和选择性。Ga和Zn物种通过从活化C-H键的酸位点去除H原子来增加丙烯的生成速率，使酸位点无需形成裂解产物即可周转。这导致所需产品产量更高，副产品如甲烷和乙烷的生成减少。重组脱附选择性去除H原子也有助于从轻烷烃中以高选择性提取有价值的H2，这是工业过程中非常需要的。", "Doi": "10.1016/s0920-5861(96)00028-4"},
{"Quotes": "\"[1] \"The aim of this study was to compute intermediates and transition states involved in the catalytic cycle for the dehy- drogenation of ethane to ethene in a zinc-exchanged zeolite.\" [2] \"The results of calculations provided two distinct routes of ethane activation on the zeolite-coordinated Zn cations. The rst route starts with the alkyl activation of a CH bond (RdHd), whereas the second route starts with carbenium activation (RdHd).\" [3] \"The rst step of ethane10h13 and propane14,15 aroma- tisation in a Zn-doped zeolite catalyst is the dehydrogenation of these alkanes to the corresponding alkenes. The alkenes then undergo dehydrocyclooligomerisation.\" [4] \"The results obtained indicate that the reaction proceeds via a mechanism starting from the alkyl rupture of the ethane CH bond and the zinc cation acts as an acceptor of the alkyl group.\" [5] \"The computed activation energies for these three steps Brnsted are 18.4, 53.4 and 20.5 kcal mol1, respectively.\" [6] \"The alternative mechanism starting from the carbenium activation with the zinc cation abstracting the hydride ion, is unfavourable because of the high (C2H5dHd),activation barrier for the rst step (67.6 kcal mol1).\"", "English": "\"The composition, structure, and reaction conditions of metal-based catalysts, such as zinc-exchanged zeolites, significantly influence the mechanisms and efficiency of alkane transformations. The study focused on the dehydrogenation of ethane to ethene in a zinc-exchanged zeolite, revealing two distinct routes of ethane activation. The first route involves the alkyl activation of a CH bond, while the second route involves carbenium activation. The dehydrogenation of alkanes to alkenes is the first step in the aromatization process in a Zn-doped zeolite catalyst, followed by dehydrocyclooligomerization. The mechanism of the reaction starts with the alkyl rupture of the ethane CH bond, with the zinc cation acting as an acceptor of the alkyl group. The computed activation energies for the three steps involved in the alkyl route are 18.4, 53.4, and 20.5 kcal mol1, respectively. The alternative mechanism starting from the carbenium activation is unfavorable due to the high activation barrier for the first step. The literature does not provide information on how the composition, structure, and reaction conditions of metal-based catalysts, including supported vanadium oxides and metal-exchanged zeolites, influence the mechanisms and efficiency of alkane transformations, particularly in processes such as oxidative dehydrogenation and zeolite-catalyzed reactions, and what factors contribute to their industrial significance. The composition, structure, and reaction conditions of metal-based catalysts, including supported vanadium oxides and metal-exchanged zeolites, significantly influence the mechanisms and efficiency of alkane transformations. For instance, in Zn-exchanged zeolites, the location of metal cations in the zeolite channels and their substitution for protons play a crucial role in the catalytic activity towards alkane aromatization. The catalytic cycle for alkyl activation consists of three elementary steps: rupture of the ethane CH bond on the Zn-O pair, formation of ethene from the alkyl group bound to Zn, and formation of dihydrogen from the proton and hydrogen bound to Zn. The computed activation energies for these steps are 18.4, 53.4, and 20.5 kcal mol-1, respectively. The alternative mechanism starting from the carbenium activation is less favorable due to the high activation barrier for the first step (67.6 kcal mol-1). The industrial significance of these catalysts is due to their ability to increase the selectivity of zeolite catalysts towards aromatization of small alkanes, which is essential for the commercial Cyclar process and other aromatization processes for light hydrocarbons. The study aimed to compute intermediates and transition states involved in the catalytic cycle for the dehydrogenation of ethane to ethene in a zinc-exchanged zeolite. Two distinct routes of ethane activation on the zeolite-coordinated Zn cations were found. The first route starts with the alkyl activation of a CH bond, while the second route starts with carbenium activation. The first step of ethane and propane aromatization in a Zn-doped zeolite catalyst is the dehydrogenation of these alkanes to the corresponding alkenes, followed by dehydrocyclooligomerization. The reaction proceeds via a mechanism starting from the alkyl rupture of the ethane CH bond, with the zinc cation acting as an acceptor of the alkyl group. The computed activation energies for the three steps are 18.4, 53.4, and 20.5 kcal mol1, respectively. The alternative mechanism starting from the carbenium activation with the zinc cation abstracting the hydride ion is unfavorable due to the high activation barrier for the first step.\"", "Chinese": "\"金属基催化剂的组成、结构和反应条件，如锌交换沸石，对烷烃转化的机制和效率有重大影响。研究集中于锌交换沸石中乙烷脱氢至乙烯的过程，揭示了乙烷活化的两种不同途径。第一条途径涉及CH键的烷基活化，而第二条途径涉及卡宾活化。在Zn掺杂沸石催化剂中，烷烃脱氢为烯烃是芳构化过程的第一步，随后是脱氢环寡聚化。反应机制从乙烷CH键的烷基断裂开始，锌阳离子作为烷基基团的接受者。计算得出的三个步骤的活化能分别为18.4、53.4和20.5 kcal mol1。从卡宾活化开始的替代机制由于第一步的高活化能而不利。文献没有提供关于金属基催化剂（包括支撑的钒氧化物和金属交换沸石）的组成、结构和反应条件如何影响烷烃转化的机理和效率，特别是在氧化脱氢和沸石催化反应等过程中的信息，以及哪些因素对它们的工业意义有贡献。金属基催化剂的组成、结构和反应条件，包括支撑的钒氧化物和金属交换沸石，对烷烃转化的机制和效率有重大影响。例如，在Zn交换沸石中，金属阳离子在沸石通道中的位置和它们对质子的替代在催化活性向烷烃芳构化方面起着关键作用。烷基活化的催化循环包括三个基本步骤：在Zn-O对上断裂乙烷CH键，从与Zn结合的烷基基团形成乙烯，以及从与Zn结合的质子和氢形成二氢。这些步骤的计算活化能分别为18.4、53.4和20.5 kcal mol-1。从卡宾激活开始的替代机制由于第一步的高活化能（67.6 kcal mol-1）而不那么有利。这些催化剂的工业重要性在于它们能够提高沸石催化剂对小烷烃的芳构化选择性，这对商业Cyclar过程和其他轻烃的芳构化过程至关重要。这项研究旨在计算与催化循环相关的中间体和过渡态，该催化循环涉及在锌交换沸石中将乙烷脱氢为乙烯的过程。发现了两种不同的乙烷在沸石配位的Zn阳离子上的活化途径。第一条途径从CH键的烷基活化开始，而第二条途径从卡宾活化开始。在Zn掺杂沸石催化剂中，乙烷和丙烷芳构化的第一步是将这些烷烃脱氢为相应的烯烃，随后进行脱氢环寡聚化。反应通过从乙烷CH键的烷基断裂开始的机制进行，锌阳离子作为烷基的接受者。计算出的三个步骤的活化能分别为18.4、53.4和20.5 kcal mol1。从卡宾活化开始，锌阳离子抽取氢离子的替代机制，由于第一步的高活化能而不利。\"", "Doi": "10.1039/a909426a"},
{"Quotes": "[1] \"The catalytic conversion of methane to more valu- able liquid fuels is still a challenging problem in the eld of catalysis [13].\"\n          [2] \"Among the different routes proposed during the previous years, the direct partial oxidation of methane to C1 oxygenates, formaldehyde or methanol, has been one of the most studied since it could potentially substitute the conventional three step' industrial process.\"\n          [3] \"The nature and the dispersion of the metal oxide phase have a great inuence on the catalysts behavior.\"\n          [4] \"Banares et al. [13], reported selectivities above 90% at methane conversion of 0.6% using a MoO3/SiO2 catalyst.\"\n          [5] \"It has been demonstrated that the nature and the dispersion of the metal oxide phase have a great inuence on the catalysts behavior.\"\n          [6] \"Banares et al. [13,14] and Faraldos et al. [15] have reported that methane conversion and formaldehyde selectivity are dependent on metal loading and the dispersion of the surface species.\"\n          [7] \"In this paper, we report the results obtained in the partial oxidation of methane to formaldehyde over W/HZSM-5 catalysts using molecular oxygen as oxidant.\"\n          [8] \"Formaldehyde selectivity seems to be related to the dispersion of the tungsten oxide phase, which, in turn, is inuenced by the metal loading.\"", "English": "The catalytic conversion of methane to more valuable liquid fuels is a significant challenge in the field of catalysis. Direct partial oxidation of methane to C1 oxygenates, such as formaldehyde or methanol, is a widely studied route that could potentially replace the conventional three-step industrial process. The nature and dispersion of the metal oxide phase have a significant impact on the behavior of catalysts. Banares et al. reported formaldehyde selectivities above 90% at a methane conversion of 0.6% using a MoO3/SiO2 catalyst. It has been demonstrated that the nature and dispersion of the metal oxide phase greatly influence the behavior of catalysts. Banares et al. and Faraldos et al. have reported that methane conversion and formaldehyde selectivity are dependent on metal loading and the dispersion of surface species. This paper reports the results of the partial oxidation of methane to formaldehyde over W/HZSM-5 catalysts using molecular oxygen as an oxidant. Formaldehyde selectivity appears to be related to the dispersion of the tungsten oxide phase, which is influenced by metal loading.", "Chinese": "将甲烷催化转化为更有价值的液体燃料是催化领域的一个重大挑战。直接将甲烷部分氧化为C1氧酸，如甲醛或甲醇，是一种广泛研究的途径，有可能取代传统的三步工业过程。金属氧化物相的性质和分散性对催化剂的行为有重大影响。Banares等人报道，在甲烷转化率为0.6%时，使用MoO3/SiO2催化剂，甲醛选择性超过90%。已经证明，金属氧化物相的性质和分散性对催化剂的行为有重大影响。Banares等人和Faraldos等人报告说，甲烷转化率和甲醛选择性取决于金属负载和表面物种的分散性。本文报道了使用分子氧作为氧化剂，在W/HZSM-5催化剂上将甲烷部分氧化为甲醛的结果。甲醛选择性似乎与钨氧化物相的分散性有关，而钨氧化物相的分散性又受到金属负载的影响。", "Doi": "10.1016/s0926-860x(98)00114-8"},
{"Quotes": "[1] \"The catalysts and reaction conditions are presented. Emphasis has been focused on the modification of catalysts and optimization of reaction conditions.\"\n          [2] \"The results of investigations on the interactions between Mo and/or transition metal ions and the zeolite support, as well as, the reaction mechanisms of the formation of aromatics and carbonaceous deposits are discussed.\"\n          [3] \"The channel structure and acidity of the HZSM-5 zeolite, as well as, the valence and location of Mo species are crucial factors for the catalytic performance.\"\n          [4] \"The loading of Ru, Pt, W, Zr, Co, Fe, and Cr can enhance the reactivity and/or stability of the catalysts, while the addition of V, Li, and P has the opposite influence.\"\n          [5] \"In addition, the preparation method, the consequence of impregnation of the metal components, and the calcined temperature, etc. can also affect the performance.\"\n          [6] \"Various pre-treatments and different reaction conditions, such as pre-treatment atmosphere and temperature, reaction temperature, pressure, methane space velocity, and regeneration, exerted great influences on the catalytic performance.\"\n          [7] \"The interaction between the Mo species and HZSM-5 is of special significance for the understanding of methane dehydro-aromatization over Mo/HZSM-5 catalysts.\"\n          [8] \"The introduction of Mo species and/or the addition of the second metal component changed the acid sites of the zeolite, decreasing the amount of strong acid sites and increasing that of moderate strength acid sites.\"\n          [9] \"The mode of methane activation continues to be the focus of debate in the literature and many kinds of active sites and reaction mechanisms have been proposed.\"\n          [10] \"The heavy carbonaceous deposit formed during the methane dehydro-aromatization is a major obstacle for a better understanding of the reaction and for process development.\"\n          [11] \"The real status of the Mo species during the reaction and the role of the Mo species and HZSM-5 zeolite for the elemental reaction pathway of methane dehydro-aromatization over Mo/HZSM-5 catalysts are of general significance for methane chemistry and for the development of the theory of methane activation.\"", "English": "The composition, structure, and reaction conditions of metal-based catalysts, including supported vanadium oxides and metal-exchanged zeolites, have a significant impact on the mechanisms and efficiency of alkane transformations. The modification of catalysts and optimization of reaction conditions are emphasized. The interactions between metal ions and the zeolite support, as well as the reaction mechanisms of the formation of aromatics and carbonaceous deposits, are discussed. The channel structure and acidity of the HZSM-5 zeolite, as well as the valence and location of Mo species, are crucial factors for the catalytic performance. The loading of certain metals can enhance the reactivity and/or stability of the catalysts, while the addition of others has the opposite influence. The preparation method, the consequence of impregnation of the metal components, and the calcined temperature can also affect the performance. Various pre-treatments and different reaction conditions exert great influences on the catalytic performance. The interaction between the Mo species and HZSM-5 is significant for understanding the reaction. The introduction of Mo species and/or the addition of the second metal component changes the acid sites of the zeolite. The mode of methane activation is a focus of debate, with various active sites and reaction mechanisms proposed. The heavy carbonaceous deposit formed during the reaction is a major obstacle for understanding and process development. The real status of the Mo species during the reaction and its role in the reaction pathway are significant for methane chemistry and the development of the theory of methane activation.", "Chinese": "金属基催化剂的组成、结构和反应条件，包括支撑的钒氧化物和金属交换沸石，对烷烃转化的机制和效率有重大影响。催化剂的改性和反应条件的优化被强调。金属离子和沸石载体之间的相互作用，以及芳烃和碳沉积物形成反应机制的讨论。H-ZSM-5沸石的通道结构和酸性，以及Mo物种的价态和位置，是催化性能的关键因素。某些金属的负载可以增强催化剂的反应性和/或稳定性，而其他金属的添加则有相反的影响。制备方法、金属组分浸渍的后果和煅烧温度也会影响性能。各种预处理和不同的反应条件对催化性能有重大影响。Mo物种和H-ZSM-5之间的相互作用对于理解反应具有重要意义。Mo物种的引入和/或第二金属组分的添加改变了沸石的酸性位点。甲烷活化模式是争论的焦点，提出了各种活性位点和反应机制。在反应过程中形成的大量碳沉积物是理解和工艺开发的主要障碍。Mo物种在反应过程中的真实状态及其在Mo/HZSM-5催化剂上甲烷脱氢芳构化反应路径中的作用，对甲烷化学和甲烷活化理论的发展具有普遍意义。", "Doi": "10.1016/s0926-860x(99)00210-0"},
{"Quotes": "[1] \"Supported vanadium oxides are particularly noteworthy because the active sites possibly involve isolated VO species (in contrast to the other systems based on MoOx or WOx).\"\n          [2] \"Such processes are particularly important for alkenes having allylic CH bonds, e.g. propene and higher alkenes, which are more readily activated.\"\n          [3] \"Small clusters and particularly isolated sites on fully covered oxide surfaces have been proposed to be essential to achieve high selectivities.\"\n          [4] \"It is therefore not surprising that the support is an important component in the catalyst formulation, as it can more or less stabilize isolated centers, small clusters vs larger V2O5 crystallites.\"\n          [5] \"Overall, silica can be regarded as the optimal support in terms of selectivity.\"\n          [6] \"Another important fact is that the optimal temperature window for this process is quite narrow, and around 500 C, lower temperatures favor combustion while unselective gas phase reactions start to be competitive at higher temperatures (>550 C).\"\n          [7] \"ODH on supported VOx also follows the typical Marsvan Krevelen mechanism, i.e. oxidation of the alkane with a concomitant reduction of metal oxo surface species followed by a reoxidation of the active sites by molecular oxygen and desorption of water.\"\n          [8] \"The terminal oxo species of VV surface species are the most reactive O sites according to DFT calculations on a model for isolated silica supported vanadyl species.\"\n          [9] \"Similar results were obtained by periodic calculations on V2O5.\"\n          [10] \"The most favored CH bond activation step corresponds to a H-abstraction, which yields a radical intermediate and a reduced VIVOH species.\"\n          [11] \"Calculations also suggest that the formation of propene in the propane dehydrogenation is most favored via subsequent H-abstraction of the propyl radical on an adjacent isolated VO species.\"\n          [12] \"Metal exchange zeolites (M-zeolites) have concentrated a large research effort, because of their ability to transform alkanes into alkenes and aromatics.\"\n          [13] \"They can also be used to catalyze the alkylation of aromatics with methane, the coaromatization of methane and alkanes, and the direct aromatization of methane.\"\n          [14] \"While all these transformations are still subject to many mechanistic debates and detailed investigations, Malkyl species are probably key intermediates.\"\n          [15] \"These M-zeolites can be of various structures (typically identified with three letter codes: MFI, MOR, ZSM-5...) and compositions, and can include a wide range of metals M, ranging from main group (Al, Ga) to transition-metal elements (Cu, Fe, Mn, Mo, Pt, W, Zn, ...).\"\n          [16] \"A vast research effort has focused on Ga- and Zn-zeolites because of their industrial relevance and their unprecedented reactivity, and these systems will be discussed hereafter in more detail.\"\n          [17] \"Conversion of alkanes into aromatics takes place via successive dehydrogenation, oligomerization, and cyclization steps.\"\n          [18] \"Ga-zeolites act as a multifunctional catalyst, and one of the key steps, the formation of alkenes from alkanes, takes place at Ga sites and involves a CH bond activation and formation of a Gaalkyl intermediate.\"\n          [19] \"Ga-zeolites are also known to activate H2 and alkanes and to catalyze H/D exchange reactions.\"\n          [20] \"These species correspond to highly Lewis acidic centers, which can readily polarize and activate the CH bond of alkanes as well as H2 to generate GaR (or GaH) and OH surface species.\"\n          [21] \"Zn-zeolites display a very similar reactivity pattern: H2 and alkane activation, H/D exchange, formation of aromatics from alkanes, and the coaromatization of methane and alkane.\"\n          [22] \"Alkane activation (including methane) also occurs via CH bond activation and formation of metalalkyl intermediates, which have been experimentally observed on different Zn-zeolites.\"\n          [23] \"M-exchange zeolites and particularly those containing Mo or even Zn also catalyze the direct conversion of methane into benzene and H2 with a high selectivity (>90%).\"\n          [24] \"While the structure and the nature of the active sites are still a matter of debate, it is accepted that methane is first converted into ethylene, which is then converted into benzene through acid catalysis.\"\n          [25] \"Several mechanisms have been proposed for the first step involving the formation of ethylene, and they involve the following: (1) carbocations, (2) radicals, or (3) organometallic intermediates, and more specifically alkylidenes, alkylidynes, or carbides.\"\n          [26] \"It is therefore possible that CH bond activation on MoCx species leads to the growth of an alkyl chain and the formation of alkenes, similarly to what is observed in the nonoxidative coupling of methane on silica supported tantalum hydrides.\"\n          [27] \"Under oxidizing conditions, metal-exchange zeolites, and, more specifically, those containing MoOx and WOx, catalyze the direct oxidation of methane into methanol/formaldehyde and related oxidation processes.\"\n          [28] \"Fe-zeolites are also noteworthy: they catalyze the direct and selective oxidation of benzene into phenol by N2O.\"\n          [29] \"While this reaction corresponds to the selective functionalization of an aromatic CH bond, several mechanisms are possible, such as the direct insertion of O in the CH bond of benzene or the epoxidation followed by an acid catalyzed rearrangement of the unstable epoxide into phenol.\"", "English": "Supported vanadium oxides are particularly noteworthy for their active sites involving isolated VO species, which are crucial for the selective activation of alkenes with allylic CH bonds, such as propene. Small clusters and isolated sites on fully covered oxide surfaces are essential for high selectivities, with silica being the optimal support. The optimal temperature window for oxidative dehydrogenation is narrow, around 500 C, to avoid combustion at lower temperatures and unselective gas phase reactions at higher temperatures. The process follows the Marsvan Krevelen mechanism, with the terminal oxo species of VV surface species being the most reactive. DFT calculations support these findings, indicating that H-abstraction is the most favored CH bond activation step, leading to the formation of propene via subsequent H-abstraction on adjacent isolated VO species.\n          Metal-exchanged zeolites (M-zeolites) have been the focus of extensive research due to their ability to transform alkanes into alkenes and aromatics, catalyze alkylation reactions, and directly aromatize methane. The transformations involve complex mechanisms, with metalalkyl species as key intermediates. M-zeolites can have various structures and compositions, including a wide range of metals from main group to transition metals. Ga- and Zn-zeolites are of particular interest due to their industrial relevance and reactivity. The conversion of alkanes into aromatics occurs through dehydrogenation, oligomerization, and cyclization steps, with Ga-zeolites acting as multifunctional catalysts. These zeolites can activate H2 and alkanes, catalyze H/D exchange reactions, and form metalalkyl intermediates. Zn-zeolites display similar reactivity patterns, including the coaromatization of methane and alkanes. M-exchange zeolites, especially those containing Mo or Zn, can directly convert methane into benzene and H2 with high selectivity. The mechanism for the conversion of methane into ethylene is still debated, involving carbocations, radicals, or organometallic intermediates. Under oxidizing conditions, metal-exchanged zeolites containing MoOx and WOx catalyze the direct oxidation of methane into methanol/formaldehyde. Fe-zeolites are noteworthy for their selective oxidation of benzene into phenol by N2O, involving the functionalization of an aromatic CH bond.", "Chinese": "支撑的钒氧化物因其活性位点可能涉及孤立的VO物种而特别引人注目，这对于选择性激活具有烯丙基CH键的烯烃（如丙烯）至关重要。小簇和孤立位点在完全覆盖的氧化物表面上对于实现高选择性至关重要，二氧化硅是最佳的支撑体。氧化脱氢的最佳温度窗口很窄，大约在500°C，较低的温度有利于燃烧，而较高的温度（>550°C）则开始出现非选择性的气相反应。该过程遵循Marsvan Krevelen机制，VV表面物种的终端氧物种是最具反应性的O位点。DFT计算支持这些发现，表明H-抽象是最受青睐的CH键活化步骤，通过在相邻的孤立VO物种上进行后续H-抽象，形成丙烯。\n          金属交换沸石（M-沸石）因其能够将烷烃转化为烯烃和芳烃而成为大量研究的焦点，它们还可以催化烷烃与甲烷的烷基化反应，以及直接芳构化甲烷。尽管所有这些转化仍然存在许多机理争议和详细研究，但金属烷基物种可能是关键中间体。这些M-沸石可以具有各种结构（通常用三个字母代码标识：MFI，MOR，ZSM-5...）和组成，可以包括从主族（Al，Ga）到过渡金属元素（Cu，Fe，Mn，Mo，Pt，W，Zn，...）的广泛金属M。大量的研究集中在Ga和Zn沸石上，因为它们的工业相关性和前所未有的反应性。烷烃转化为芳烃通过连续的脱氢、寡聚和环化步骤发生，Ga沸石作为多功能催化剂发挥作用。这些沸石可以激活H2和烷烃，催化H/D交换反应，并形成金属烷基中间体。Zn沸石显示出非常相似的反应模式，包括甲烷和烷烃的共芳构化。M交换沸石，特别是那些含有Mo或Zn的沸石，可以以高选择性（>90％）直接将甲烷转化为苯和H2。甲烷转化为乙烯的机制仍在争论中，涉及碳正离子、自由基或有机金属中间体。在氧化条件下，含有MoOx和WOx的金属交换沸石催化甲烷直接氧化为甲醇/甲醛和相关氧化过程。Fe沸石因其通过N2O选择性氧化苯为酚而值得注意，涉及芳烃CH键的功能化。", "Doi": "10.1021/cr900122p_2"},
{"Quotes": "[1] \"γ -Al2O3-supported vanadium oxide catalysts (06.3 wt% V atoms) were prepared, characterized, and tested for the oxidative dehydrogenation (ODH) of both ethane and n-butane.\"\n          [2] \"The vana- dium loading strongly influences the catalytic behavior of γ -Al2O3- supported vanadium oxide catalysts during the ODH of n-butane and ethane.\"\n          [3] \"While the catalytic activity in the ODH reactions in- creaseswiththevanadiumloading,theselectivitytothecorrespond- ing olefins shows a maximum for catalysts with 34 wt% V atoms.\"\n          [4] \"In addition, the selectivity to oxydehydrogenation products during the ODH of butane was lower than the selectivity to ethene during the ODH of ethane.\"\n          [5] \"Associated VO4 tetrahedra were observed by 51V-NMR on catalysts with V loading lower than 5 wt%, while VO6 octahedra were predominant on catalysts with higher V loading.\"\n          [6] \"Although catalysts with octahedral V5+ species show higher catalytic activity, higher selectivity to oxydehydrogenation reactions was achieved on catalysts in which mainly tetrahedral V5+ species were observed.\"\n          [7] \"The number and nature of the acid sites also change with the vanadium loading. Thus, Lewis acid sites were ob- served mainly on catalysts with low V loading, while both Lewis and Brnsted acid sites were observed on catalysts with high V loading.\"\n          [8] \"Vanadia catalysts supported on Al2O3 have been char- acterized by a variety of physicochemical methods.\"\n          [9] \"The data obtained from Raman (1216), 51V NMR (1517), ESR (1820), XPS (14, 21), UVVis reflectance (19), EXAFSXANES (22, 23), temperature-programmed re- duction (12, 14, 23, 24), and infrared and microcalorimetric studies of adsorbed probe molecules (2527) indicate that the type of vanadium species depends on the vanadium con- tent.\"\n          [10] \"If a vanadium oxide monolayer completely covering thesurfaceofthesupportshouldneed4.98 × 1014molecules V2O5 cm2, the appearance of V2O5 crystallites on Al2O3 occurs at a vanadium loading of about 60% of the theoret- ical monolayer (14).\"\n          [11] \"At lower vanadium loadings, isolated and/or associated tetrahedral and/or octahedral V5+ species have been observed.\"", "English": "The composition, structure, and reaction conditions of metal-based catalysts, such as supported vanadium oxides, significantly influence the mechanisms and efficiency of alkane transformations in oxidative dehydrogenation processes. The vanadium loading on γ -Al2O3-supported vanadium oxide catalysts strongly affects the catalytic behavior for the oxidative dehydrogenation of n-butane and ethane. The catalytic activity increases with the vanadium loading, but the selectivity to corresponding olefins shows a maximum for catalysts with 3-4 wt% V atoms. The selectivity to oxydehydrogenation products during the oxidative dehydrogenation of butane is lower than the selectivity to ethene during the oxidative dehydrogenation of ethane. The type of vanadium species, such as VO4 tetrahedra or VO6 octahedra, depends on the vanadium content, with tetrahedral V5+ species observed on catalysts with lower V loading and octahedral V5+ species predominant on catalysts with higher V loading. Catalysts with octahedral V5+ species show higher catalytic activity, but higher selectivity to oxydehydrogenation reactions is achieved on catalysts with mainly tetrahedral V5+ species. The number and nature of acid sites, such as Lewis and Brnsted acid sites, also change with the vanadium loading. The type of vanadium species and the nature of acid sites contribute to the industrial significance of these catalysts by affecting the selectivity and activity in alkane transformations.", "Chinese": "金属基催化剂的组成、结构和反应条件，如支撑的钒氧化物，在氧化脱氢过程中对烷烃转化的机制和效率有重大影响。γ -Al2O3支撑的钒氧化物催化剂上的钒负载量对n-丁烷和乙烷的氧化脱氢的催化行为有重大影响。催化活性随钒负载量的增加而增加，但对相应烯烃的选择性在3-4 wt% V原子的催化剂上达到最大。在丁烷的氧化脱氢过程中，对氧脱氢产物的选择性低于在乙烷的氧化脱氢过程中对乙烯的选择性。钒物种的类型，如VO4四面体或VO6八面体，取决于钒含量，较低的V负载量的催化剂上观察到四面体V5+物种，而较高的V负载量的催化剂上主要观察到八面体V5+物种。具有八面体V5+物种的催化剂显示出较高的催化活性，但在主要具有四面体V5+物种的催化剂上，对氧脱氢反应的选择性较高。酸位点的数量和性质，如Lewis和Brnsted酸位点，也随钒负载量的变化而变化。钒物种的类型和酸位点的性质通过影响烷烃转化的选择性和活性，对这些催化剂的工业意义有贡献。", "Doi": "10.1006/jcat.1997.1673"},
{"Quotes": "[1] \"We investigate possible mechanisms of oxidative dehydrogenation of propane using density functional theory. Monomeric vanadium oxide species supported on silica are modeled by vanadyl-substituted silsesquioxane.\"\n          [2] \"The catalytic activation of CH bonds is of fundamental interest, because it is the crucial step in important technological processes and also in many enzymatic reactions.\"\n          [3] \"We examine possible reaction mechanisms for the oxidative dehydrogenation of propane by supported transition metal oxide catalysts. Specifically we are interested in V2O5 supported on SiO22,12,13 and consider monomeric OV(O)3 surface species, which together with dimeric and oligomeric V2O5 species are present on catalyst surfaces with low V2O5 loadings.\"\n          [4] \"The first hydrogen abstraction occurs exclusively on OVV sites, while the second hydrogen abstraction can also occur on VOSi bridging oxygen sites.\"\n          [5] \"The rate of propene formation after readsorption on OVV sites is much larger than the rate of isopropyl alcohol (or propene) formation after readsorption on HOVIV sites.\"\n          [6] \"With regard to the type of active oxygen species in the reaction, we find that only vanadyl sites are involved in the rate-determining step, but the second hydrogen abstraction may occur also at VOSi bridging oxygen sites without changing the overall kinetics of the reaction.\"\n          [7] \"Comparison with recent DFT calculations for V2O5(001) crystal surfaces9 indicates that vanadia sites may be significantly more active in the ODH of propane if they are part of the bulk surface and not supported as monomers on silica.\"", "English": "The composition, structure, and reaction conditions of metal-based catalysts, such as supported vanadium oxides and metal-exchanged zeolites, significantly influence the mechanisms and efficiency of alkane transformations, particularly in oxidative dehydrogenation processes. The initial step in these transformations is the activation of CH bonds, which is a crucial step in both technological processes and enzymatic reactions. For the oxidative dehydrogenation of propane, monomeric vanadium oxide species supported on silica are modeled using vanadyl-substituted silsesquioxane. The first hydrogen abstraction occurs exclusively on OVV sites, while the second hydrogen abstraction can also occur on VOSi bridging oxygen sites. The rate of propene formation after readsorption on OVV sites is much larger than the rate of isopropyl alcohol or propene formation after readsorption on HOVIV sites. Only vanadyl sites are involved in the rate-determining step, but the second hydrogen abstraction may occur also at VOSi bridging oxygen sites without changing the overall kinetics of the reaction. Vanadia sites may be significantly more active in the oxidative dehydrogenation of propane if they are part of the bulk surface and not supported as monomers on silica.", "Chinese": "金属基催化剂的组成、结构和反应条件,如支撑的钒氧化物和金属交换沸石,对烷烃转化的机制和效率有重大影响,特别是在丙烷氧化脱氢等过程中。CH键的催化活化是技术过程和许多酶促反应中的关键步骤。对于丙烷的氧化脱氢,使用被钒氧基取代的倍半硅氧烷来模拟支撑在二氧化硅上的单体钒氧化物物种。第一次氢原子抽离仅发生在OVV位点,而第二次氢原子抽离也可以发生在VOSi桥接氧位点。在OVV位点重吸附后,丙烯的形成速率远大于在HOVIV位点重吸附后异丙醇或丙烯的形成速率。只有钒氧基位点参与了决定速率的步骤,但第二次氢原子抽离也可以在VOSi桥接氧位点发生,而不改变整体反应动力学。如果钒酸盐位点是体相表面的一部分,而不是作为单体支撑在二氧化硅上,它们在丙烷氧化脱氢中可能具有显著更高的活性。", "Doi": "10.1021/jp071409e"},
{"Quotes": "[1] \"ZSM-5 molecular sieves with the iron and silicon tetrahedral framework were used as catalysts. The Si/Fe molar ratio was 45, 34 and 22. Fe-ZSM-5 was applied both in the sodium and hydrogen form.\"\n          [2] \"The reaction was carried out at the atmospheric pressure at 350650 8C.\"\n          [3] \"Fe-ZSM-5 consists of spherulitic aggregates. No differences in shape were observed for all the samples.\"\n          [4] \"The XRD powder patterns of the prepared Fe-HZSM-5 catalyst are presented. All the patterns of prepared zeolites exhibit the typical lines for the zeolite type ZSM-5. However, the obtained line intensities differ depending on the Fe content.\"\n          [5] \"The splitting of the reflection at 2u = 45.5 (Fig. 3) increases with increasing Si/Fe which, by analogy with the Si/Al systems consistent with the incorporation of Fe(III) into framework sites.\"\n          [6] \"The highest methane conversion amounting to 31.51% was reached while Fe-HZSM-5 with the largest iron content was applied. Increasing the iron content resulted in the rise of methane conversion.\"\n          [7] \"Introducing the sodium form of molecular sieves led to the rise in the selectivity of the oxidation of methane to oxygenates.\"\n          [8] \"The highest selectivity of methane to methanol oxidation (about 74%) was attained while a catalyst with the lowest iron content was administered.\"\n          [9] \"The increase of the temperature results in the rise of methane conversion.\"\n          [10] \"Extending the contact time and increasing the temperature resulted in lowering the selectivity of the oxidation of methane to methanol for all the catalysts.\"\n          [11] \"Methanol is produced over Fe-ZSM-5 at temperature 350 8C.\"\n          [12] \"The raise of temperature reduces methanol concentration in products because of its oxidation to formaldehyde and then to carbon dioxide.\"\n          [13] \"If Fe-HZSM-5 is applied, the oxidation of methane to methanol and to carbon dioxide follow the same speed pattern. Next, methanol slowly oxidises to formaldehyde and then to carbon dioxide.\"\n          [14] \"If Fe-NaZSM-5 has been used as a catalyst, then the methanol producing reaction is much faster than that carbon dioxide generating. However, methanol oxidises to for- maldehyde and then to carbon dioxide more rapidly than in the case of the reaction with Fe-HZSM-5 applied as a catalyst.\"", "English": "The composition, structure, and reaction conditions of metal-based catalysts, such as Fe-ZSM-5, influence the mechanisms and efficiency of alkane transformations. The Si/Fe molar ratio, the form of Fe-ZSM-5 (sodium or hydrogen), and the temperature and contact time all play a role in the conversion of methane to methanol and carbon dioxide. The structure of Fe-ZSM-5, characterized by spherulitic aggregates and typical XRD patterns for ZSM-5, indicates the incorporation of Fe(III) into framework sites. The increase in iron content leads to higher methane conversion, while the sodium form of molecular sieves improves the selectivity of methane oxidation to oxygenates. The highest selectivity for methane to methanol oxidation is achieved with a catalyst containing the lowest iron content. Higher temperatures and longer contact times increase methane conversion but decrease the selectivity of methane oxidation to methanol. Methanol is produced at lower temperatures, but its concentration decreases at higher temperatures due to further oxidation to formaldehyde and carbon dioxide.", "Chinese": "金属基催化剂的组成、结构和反应条件，如Fe-ZSM-5，影响烷烃转化的机制和效率。催化剂中的Si/Fe摩尔比影响甲烷转化率，铁含量较高时转化率较高。催化剂的钠形式增加了甲烷氧化为含氧化合物的选择性。催化剂中存在铁影响X射线衍射图案中的线强度，表明其被纳入框架中。催化剂以球状聚集体的形式存在，铁含量影响XRD图案中的线强度。这些过程中使用的催化剂通常是具有特定结构的沸石，如ZSM-5，可以将金属离子纳入其框架中。较高的温度和较长的接触时间导致甲醇生产的选择性降低，因为甲醇进一步氧化为甲醛和二氧化碳。这些过程中使用的催化剂通常是具有特定结构的沸石，如ZSM-5，可以将金属离子纳入其框架中。然而，这些过程的效率受到催化剂组成、结构和反应条件的影响，必须优化以获得最大产量和选择性。", "Doi": "10.1016/j.apcata.2004.09.005"},
{"Quotes": "[1] \"The majority of papers focus on some specific aspects that may affect the reactivity of the catalysts investigated. For instance, in the case of supported metal oxide catalysts, in addition to the usual morphological aspects, some of the important features affecting the performance are: the degree of agglomeration of Me cations (from isolated units to bulk Me oxide); acidbase characteristics; the valence state of the metal cation under reaction conditions; the collective electronic properties of the solid.\"\n          [2] \"In propane ODH, the catalytic activity of vanadium oxide catalysts increases with the V2O5 loading, while rates per V- atom reach a maximum on VOx domains of intermediate size, providing a balance between the activity of surface VOx species and their accessibility to reactants.\"\n          [3] \"The selectivity to the corresponding olefins shows a peak for intermediate values of active phase loading, which corresponds to the development of the monolayer structure.\"\n          [4] \"The extent of V reduction during steady-state ODH is much lower than for stoichiometric reduction of V5+ to V4+ or V3+.\"\n          [5] \"The number of catalytically significant reduced centers depends only on alkane/O2 ratios.\"\n          [6] \"The fraction of V-atoms that exist as catalytically reduced centers increases with increasing vanadia surface density and domain size up to surface densities typical of polyvanadate monolayers, and then reaches nearly constant values at higher surface densities;therefore, both isolated and polymeric species are active, but polymerized surface VO4 species are more extensively reduced than the isolated species during steady-state alkane oxidation.\"\n          [7] \"The selectivity to propylene formation is affected by surface reduction: the higher the surface reduction, the higher the selectivity.\"\n          [8] \"The use of N2O to replace O2 causes the development of a more reduced, and more selective, surface.\"\n          [9] \"The extent of reduction of the surface V5+ species also depends on the specific oxide support: V2O5-ZrO2 > V2O5-Al2O3 > V2O5-SiO2; the reac- tivity, TOF, in ethane ODH follows the same ranking.\"\n          [10] \"The role of the support on the reactivity of vanadium oxide in alkane ODH has been investigated by many authors.\"\n          [11] \"In general, in propane ODH catalysts made of Voxide supported on silica are more selective than those made with the alumina support, and the latter are more selective than those supported on titania, mainly because of the lower extent of parallel propane combustion, especially at low vanadia loading.\"\n          [12] \"The reduction and catalytic properties of active VOx domains can be significantly affected by the formation of binary dispersed structures.\"\n          [13] \"Additives (e.g., P, K, Ca, Ni, Cr, Nb, Mg, Au, Zn and Mo), sometimes added in relevant amount with respect to V,modify acidbasic and redox properties of supported vanadium oxide.\"\n          [14] \"Modification of these properties affects catalytic performance in ODH; in samples where an increase of the concentration of acid sites is observed (due to the increase in the electronegativity of the additive ions), the total activity increases.\"\n          [15] \"The addition of alkali and alkaline earth dopants decreases the activity and increases the selectivity to propylene in propane ODH.\"\n          [16] \"The order of the increasing selectivities to propylene in propane ODH follows the order of the increasing basicity and the increasing MO bond energy.\"\n          [17] \"A key factor in the design of efficient catalysts for alkane ODH is the isolation of active sites.\"\n          [18] \"Therefore, the isomorphous substitution of active metal species,e.g.,vanadium, into microporous and mesoporous materials is an attractive strategy for designing new catalysts for this reaction.\"\n          [19] \"The main drawback of these systems is that they do not always maintain the structure if high V contents are incorporated; furthermore, the incorporated V species may sometimes be easily withdrawn from the structure during the reaction.\"\n          [20] \"In the case of VCoAPO-18, the presence of both acid sites (related to the presence of Co2+ cations) and redox sites (related to the presence of V5+/4+ and Co3+/2+) seems to be an important factor in achieving high selectivities to ethylene during the ODH of ethane.\"\n          [21] \"One of the best performing catalysts in propane ODH is the VOx-SBA-15 system, prepared by an alcoholic impregnation method, in which the introduction of V species onto the inner walls of SBA-15 provides a system with a large concentration of accessible, isolated and structurally well- defined active sites.\"\n          [22] \"In general, catalysts are less active than vanadia-based catalysts, regardless of the support used.\"\n          [23] \"Propane ODH rates per Mo atom increase with increasing Mo surface density and reach a maximum value for samples with 4.5 Mo/nm2; this behavior reflects an increase in the reactivity of surface Mo species.\"\n          [24] \"The size of MoOx domains also affects the Mo O strength; stronger Mo O bonds show lower ODH activity.\"\n          [25] \"The presence of alkali (Cs, K, Li) affects the structure of MoOx domains and influences their electronic and catalytic properties.\"\n          [26] \"Propane ODH turnover rates decreases monotonically while increasing both the dopant/Mo atomic ratio and the basicity of the alkali oxide (Cs > K > Li).\"\n          [27] \"These basic oxides inhibit the initial reduction of MoOx by strengthening MoO bonds; as a result, rate-determining CH bond activation step, which involves the local reduction of Mo centers, proceed more slowly.\"\n          [28] \"The stronger inhibition of secondary propylene combustion reflects the weaker Lewis acidity of Mo sites when modified by the basic dopants; this accounts for the higher selectivity to propylene.\"", "English": "The composition, structure, and reaction conditions of metal-based catalysts, including supported vanadium oxides and metal-exchanged zeolites, significantly influence the mechanisms and efficiency of alkane transformations. Important features affecting the performance include the degree of agglomeration of metal cations, acid-base characteristics, the valence state of the metal cation under reaction conditions, and the collective electronic properties of the solid. In propane oxidative dehydrogenation, the catalytic activity of vanadium oxide catalysts increases with the V2O5 loading, while rates per vanadium atom reach a maximum on VOx domains of intermediate size, providing a balance between the activity of surface VOx species and their accessibility to reactants. The selectivity to olefins peaks at intermediate values of active phase loading, corresponding to the development of the monolayer structure. The extent of vanadium reduction during steady-state oxidative dehydrogenation is much lower than for stoichiometric reduction of V5+ to V4+ or V3+. The number of catalytically significant reduced centers depends on alkane/O2 ratios. Both isolated and polymeric species are active, but polymerized surface VO4 species are more extensively reduced than isolated species during steady-state alkane oxidation. Surface reduction affects the selectivity to propylene formation: the higher the surface reduction, the higher the selectivity. The use of N2O instead of O2 causes the development of a more reduced and more selective surface. The extent of reduction of the surface V5+ species also depends on the specific oxide support. The role of the support on the reactivity of vanadium oxide in alkane oxidative dehydrogenation has been extensively studied. Catalysts made of vanadium oxide supported on silica are more selective than those made with alumina support, which are more selective than those supported on titania, mainly due to the lower extent of parallel propane combustion, especially at low vanadia loading. The reduction and catalytic properties of active VOx domains can be significantly affected by the formation of binary dispersed structures. The selectivity to propylene can be correlated with the work function values. The relatively inert secondary surface metal oxide additives are able to weakly adsorb propane in a precursor state that supplies the catalytic active VOx sites for propane activation to propylene. With different metal oxides, turnover rates reflect CH bond cleavage activation energies, influenced by the reducibility of these metal oxides. Additives modify the acid-base and redox properties of supported vanadium oxide, affecting catalytic performance in oxidative dehydrogenation. The addition of alkali and alkaline earth dopants decreases activity and increases selectivity to propylene in propane oxidative dehydrogenation. The order of increasing selectivities to propylene in propane oxidative dehydrogenation follows the order of increasing basicity and increasing MO bond energy. The basicity of the support greatly affects selectivity. The use of a basic metal oxide support results in improved selectivity due to the possible rapid desorption of the electron-rich propylene product before further combustion to COx. In the case of VCoAPO-18, the presence of both acid sites and redox sites seems to be an important factor in achieving high selectivities to ethylene during the oxidative dehydrogenation of ethane. In general, catalysts based on supported molybdenum oxide are less active than vanadia-based catalysts, regardless of the support used.
